awd_titl_txt: Geometry and Kinematics of Deformation in the Northern      Walker Lane:  A Study of Intracontinental Strain in the     Basin and Range Province
awd_abstract_narration: One of the basic concepts of Plate Tectonics is that                       continental plates are rigid, with deformation only along their                 margins.  However, there are extensive areas within continental                 crust that have undergone large magnitude distributed deformation               at a regional scale, notably in the southwestern United States.                 This project will use a combination of field and laboratory                     techniques to evaluate the role of strike-slip faulting and block               rotation and measure the internal deformation of a portion of the               Basin and Range province, and to attempt to relate this deformation             to plate boundary processes.
